p: The results of the anti- Candida activity of the essential oil and pure compounds are shown in Table 2. All strains of C. albicans were sensitive when exposed to essential oil. Nevertheless, when comparing the areas of inhibition of the pure compounds it is possible to observe that γ-Terpinene was significantly different from α-Pinene and essential oil ( p < 0.05) for all strains. Furthermore, there were significant differences between α-Pinene and essential oil in the strain CDBB-L-1003, ( p < 0.05).
